required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of a New Chewable Versus the Swallowable Tablet of Mebendazole Against Hookworm
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of a New Chewable Tablet of Mebendazole Versus the Swallowable, Standard Tablet of Mebendazole Against Hookworm Infections in Children: a Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Public Health Laboratory Ivo de Carneri

brief_summary.textblock: The rational of this study is to provide evidence on the safety and efficacy of a new chewable tablet of mebendazole compared to the standard tablet in preschool- and school-aged children infected with hookworm.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Egg Reduction Rate (ERR) of the Two Formulations of Mebendazole Against Hookworm
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (before treatment) and sometime between 14 and 21 days post-treatment
primary_outcome.description: Eggs per gram of stool (EPG) will be assessed by adding up the egg counts from the quadruplicate Kato-Katz thick smears and multiplying this number by a factor of six. The egg reduction rate (ERR) is calculated as follows: ERR = (1-(geometric mean EPG at follow-up/geometric mean EPG at baseline))*100). Note: in contrast to the publication the "outcome measure" entry mask requires the complementary percentage: (geometric mean at follow-up/geometric mean at baseline)*100).

secondary_outcome.measure: Cure Rate (CR) of Mebendazole Against Hookworm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (before treatment) and sometime between 14 and 21 days post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Cure rates (CRs) will be calculated as the percentage of egg-positive participants at baseline who become egg-negative after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: CR of Both Mebendazole Regimens Against Trichuris Trichiura
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (before treatment) and sometime between 14 and 21 days post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Cure rates (CRs) will be calculated as the percentage of egg-positive participants at baseline who become egg-negative after treatment.

arm_group.description: 3-5 year olds allocated to the swallowable tablet arm will be given the crushed tablet on a spoon mixed with a small amount of clean water; 6-12 year olds allocated to the swallowable tablet arm will be given the whole tablet to swallow with a glass of clean water;

3-5 year olds allocated to the chewable tablet arm will be encouraged to chew the tablet and swallow it without water; if they cannot chew it then a small amount of water will be added to the tablet in a spoon; 6-12 year olds allocated to the chewable tablet arm will be encouraged to chew the tablet and then swallow it without water.

intervention.description: Treatment with one of the two formulations of mebendazole. The only difference between both arms is the type of formulation of the drug: chewable versus swallowable tablet.

facility.name: Public Health Laboratory Ivo de Carneri

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Chewable Tablet of Mebendazole
group.description: A single 500 mg dose of the new chewable mebendazole tablets will be administered to each child in this arm. Mebendazole: Treatment with one of the two formulations of mebendazole. The only difference between both arms is the type of formulation of the drug: chewable versus swallowable tablet.

group.title: Swallowable Tablet of Mebendazole
group.description: A single 500 mg dose of the standard swallowable mebendazole tablets will be administered to each child in this arm. Mebendazole: Treatment with one of the two formulations of mebendazole. The only difference between both arms is the type of formulation of the drug: chewable versus swallowable tablet.

group.title: Chewable Tablet of Mebendazole
group.description: A single 500 mg dose of the new chewable mebendazole tablets will be administered to each child in this arm. Mebendazole: Treatment with one of the two formulations of mebendazole. The only difference between both arms is the type of formulation of the drug: chewable versus swallowable tablet.

group.description: A single 500 mg dose of the standard swallowable mebendazole tablets will be administered to each child in this arm. Mebendazole: Treatment with one of the two formulations of mebendazole. The only difference between both arms is the type of formulation of the drug: chewable versus swallowable tablet.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

analysis.groups_desc: The 95% confidence intervals (CIs) for ERRs and the difference between ERRs were estimated via bootstrap resampling. Superiority was claimed if the 95% confidence interval of the difference in ERRs did not include unity. Logistic regression models were used to assess efficacy in terms of CRs. In a subsequent analysis an adjusted logistic regression (adjustment for age, sex, weight and baseline infection intensity) was performed.

reported_events.desc: Physicians and nurses actively questioned each child for adverse events using a questionnaire

group.title: Chewable Tablet of Mebendazole
group.description: A single 500 mg dose of the new chewable mebendazole tablets will be administered to each child in this arm. Mebendazole: Treatment with one of the two formulations of mebendazole. The only difference between both arms is the type of formulation of the drug: chewable versus swallowable tablet.

Mebendazole: Treatment with one of the two formulations of mebendazole. The only difference between both arms is the type of formulation of the drug: chewable versus swallowable tablet.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Swiss Tropical and Public Health Institute
